alert.note: Alert for Cleburne; Jackson; Lonoke; Monroe; Prairie; White; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 11:32PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Woodruff, northern Prairie, southeastern Jackson, south central Cleburne, north central Lonoke, north central Monroe and White Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1131 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near McFadden to Patterson to near Crosby. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. This line of storms has a history of producing 30 to 40 mph wind gusts. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Searcy... Augusta... Des Arc... Beebe... Ward... Bald Knob... Judsonia... Kensett... Higginson... Patterson... Russell... West Point... Tupelo... Hunter... Algoa... McCrory... Crosby... McFadden... Thurman... Pryor... This includes US Highway 67 between mile markers 26 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Cleburne; Jackson; Lonoke; Monroe; Prairie; White; Woodruff
